greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Differences between A008589 (multiples of 7) and A048727, a(n) = ((n*7)-Xmult(n,7)).
comment: For n = binary n[k],n[k-1],...,n[0], bits a(n) = binary b[k+1],b[k],...,b[0] are b[i] = 1 when n[i-1] + n[i-2] + n[i-3] >= 2, so the majority bit 0 or 1 among the 3 bits of n below position i (with 0 bits below the radix point of n as necessary).  This is since 7*n = 4*n + 2*n + n is n[i-1] + n[i-2] + n[i-3] at position i-1, and 4*n XOR 2*n XOR n is the same but no carry, so b[i] is the carry only. - _Kevin Ryde_, Mar 26 2021
program: (PARI) a(n)=7*n - bitxor(n, bitxor(2*n, 4*n)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 03 2016
xref: Positions of zeros are given by A048715. Cf. A048733, A342697.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 26 1999
